description: Learned borrowing from Latin pauper (“poor”). Originally a legal term. Doublet of poor.

entries.meaning: One living on or eligible for public charity.

verbs.description: pauper (third-person singular simple present paupers, present participle paupering, simple past and past participle paupered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make a pauper of; to drive into poverty.
examples: “There's no sense in you paupering yourself because you're too stubborn to take my money.”
